item.title: This Lenovo All-in-One Desktop Crashes 73% After Three Price Cuts in a Week, Now Priced Like a Tablet
item.content:encoded:
Space is limited. It’d be great to have the power and versatility that a huge PC tower offers, but if you’re in a small one bedroom or studio apartment, that’s not always an option. Or perhaps you’re someone who prefers a clean look to their desktop, opting for a minimalist aesthetic. All the more reason why you should consider an all-in-one PC. This Lenovo desktop has all the working bits that make it a computer packed into the monitor. Keep your desk clutter-free with the Lenovo 24 all-in-one desktop. Amazon has it discounted by a staggering 73%. The list price is set at $2,200, but the sale has it down to just $600. That’s a savings of $1,600.

This Lenovo all-in-one desktop measures across at 24-inches. That’s a large enough display to provide more workable space than a laptop would but still small enough to not feel like it’s consumer the room or desk you have it on. The screen is non-touch but it is anti-glare to ensure comfortable viewing in bright settings. It has a resolution of 1080p and can easily be used in a number of environments whether its your home or used as a communal computer in a school computer lab or business workstation.

See at Amazon

The monitor is on an adjustable stand. You can angle the screen toward you between -5 degrees up to 25 degrees, ensuring your always have the best view no matter how you are seated or standing in front of it.

Easy Task Management

Diving into the specs, this smart monitor is working with 32GB of RAM and has a full 1TB of storage on its internal PCIe NVMe M.2 SSD. The storage is expandable up to 4TB if you’d like more. It’s running off an Intel i3 processor with an internal graphics card. You’ll have no problem running multiple applications side by side to stay as productive as possible when working. Great for spreadsheets and the like.

The computer comes pre-installed with Windows 11 Pro, has support for Wi-Fi 6, as well as Bluetooth 5.2. It features a number of useful ports to connect to multiple accessories at once. along the back you’ll find two USB-A 2.0 ports, two USB-A 3.2 Gen 2 ports, and HDMI out to allow connecting to a second monitor, an ethernet port, as well as a combination headphone-microphone 3.5mm jack. There is also an integrated webcam and mic for video conferencing.

The all-in-one Lenovo PC even comes with a mouse and keyboard included, this way you have everything you need to get up and running right out of the box.

For a limited time, grab this Lenovo all-in-one PC for the reduced price of just $600.

item.title: The Very Finest Cosplay Fits From New York’s Anime NYC 2025
item.content:encoded:
Anime NYC is an annual New York-based event to celebrate all things anime and related Japanese pop culture. It purports to be the largest anime convention on the East Coast, with over one-hundred-thousand people showing up for the four-day event. And with its association with Crunchyroll, has become an important fixture in the Western anime calendar. As such, it brings in an impressive list of celebrity guests, and of course some incredibly fine cosplay. As ever, Mineralblu were in attendance for Kotaku, snapping the best fits for your eyeballs’ pleasure.

2025’s event saw some very big names from the world of Japanese culture. A-1 Pictures president Akira Shimizu and Blue Eye Samurai director Jane Wu were there, along with voice actors Abby Trott, Zeno Robinson and Kpop Demon Hunters‘ May Hong, among many others. But we’re here to celebrate the cosplayers, the people who put months into sewing and crafting extraordinary outfits to celebrate their favorite anime and video games. The results, as ever, are fantastic.

Check back soon for a video of the event, but in the meantime, click on for some of the most impressive costumes.

item.title: This Woman Can Thrash You At Mortal Kombat With Her 5-Day-Old Baby In Her Arms
item.content:encoded:
A Florida woman, who games under the name Legi0n, recently won a local Mortal Kombat tournament, taking home a prize pool of $28. That might not seem a particularly noteworthy incident, until you learn she achieved this with a five-day-old baby sleeping in her arms.

As superbly reported by Virginia Glaze at Dexerto, the Juicy Game Night of Orlando Florida offers a range of fighting game tournaments for locals to take part in, within which was a four-person bracket, competing to be the best of a very small bunch at Mortal Kombat XL. But what caused this to become a viral sensation was that the winner, Legi0n, was caring for her newborn baby at the time.

You might see this as impressive, simply for the extra complication of having a whole other human being sleeping on you as you attempt to play an aggressive, competitive fighting game, and yes, it certainly is. But what is more mindblowing is that Legi0n had had a cesarean section just five days earlier, following a complicated end to the pregnancy. Honestly, it’s beyond belief she was out of bed, let alone owning at MKXL.

It took me and my wife a full week before we were even able to get our shit together to the level of being able to leave the house, and then it was to stumble into a local coffee shop, our lower eyelids scraping on the ground, as we stared zombie-like at each other for the seventeen minutes he stayed asleep. And that was without a c-section, which I’m pretty sure is supposed to have you laid up in hospital for a good few days on its own. This person is extraordinary.

“I only won because she coached me mid set,” Legi0n posted to her X account, along with the cutest picture of her baby sleeping next to a piece of paper bearing the legend, “Mortal Kombat, 1st Place, $28.”

“Sending our daughter to Dreamhack,” she continues, her prize including tickets to the event.

The Juicy Game Night turns out to be where Legi0n met her husband, whom she beat during the same Mortal Kombat tournament she won this weekend.

One of my buddies/long time rivals of mine were just happy to have an excuse to boot up the game.
You guys should check out his event @CFFOSeries and other local events from @JuicyGameNight and @RetroRevivalFGC. I love our local scene, man. 🤘🏼❤️‍🔥 It was where I met my husband… https://t.co/uCOqX1Ik6r

— Goonz | ♛𝕷𝖊𝖌𝖎0̷𝖓♛ ☕{@ motherhood} (@_Legi0n_) September 29, 2025

Legi0n went on to post a very open and honest X post about the role fighting games have played in her life, including the deeply sad story that their first daughter, Alcina, died last year, caused by what she describes as “medical malpractice” following a missed tumor. During her pregnancy with that daughter, she had played a lot of Street Fighter 6, meaning the game had become inextricably linked with Alcina and obviously too hard to continue to play.

Their new daughter, Cereza, seems destined to be a Mortal Kombat girl. And her mom is, genuinely, such an inspiration. Not because she won a local fighting game tourney, but because reading through her socials, I want her to be my therapist.

“I just want people to feel like no matter what they can do things that they still love even if it’s in small chunks,” she posted to X on September 28. “Never feel like it isn’t worth it. I also want to be very vocal about how serious pregnancy and childbirth as a whole is. You can literally die and I almost did. Twice.”

Also, I just want to embed this post because it’s the best damn thing:

Also lmao at any butthurt men commenting negatively towards me living my life. I held down my hobbies, had a career level job in stem/tech as in 3D sim work, traveled frequently and entered or placed at different games in different locals or regionals over the years while doing…

— Goonz | ♛𝕷𝖊𝖌𝖎0̷𝖓♛ ☕{@ motherhood} (@_Legi0n_) September 28, 2025

I (now) fondly remember the very difficult early days of having a baby who would only sleep while being held, doing the 1 a.m. to 6 a.m. shift while my wife tried to sleep, playing video games with the kid nestled between my arms on the desk in front of me. I could manage low-key RPGs at the very most, my all-consuming tiredness removing any hope of coordination. And—key information here—I personally had taken only a minor side-role in act of giving birth. So the maddest of props to Legi0n, my new gaming hero: I wish her all the rest it’s possible to get.
